concise_definition: n. 外表, 外观, 出现, 露面

definitions.explanation_en: The way something or someone looks on the surface, often influencing first impressions, regardless of the underlying reality.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某人或某物在表面上的外观或形象，常影响第一印象，而不一定反映其真实本质。
definitions.example_en: Despite his polished appearances, he was deeply insecure.
definitions.example_cn: 尽管他外表光鲜，内心却极度缺乏安全感。

definitions.explanation_en: The act of coming into view or becoming visible, especially in a public or formal context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某人或某物进入视野或变得可见，尤其在公共或正式场合中的露面。
definitions.example_en: The president made a surprise appearance at the charity event.
definitions.example_cn: 总统意外现身于这场慈善活动。

definitions.explanation_en: A performance or public showing, especially by an actor, musician, or athlete.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指演员、音乐家或运动员的公开演出或亮相。
definitions.example_en: Her appearance at the Grammy Awards was widely praised by the media.
definitions.example_cn: 她在格莱美奖颁奖典礼上的亮相广受媒体赞誉。

comparison.analysis: “Look” (外表) 更口语化，常用于描述某人或某物的总体视觉感受，如 “He has a tired look.”，侧重主观印象。而 “appearance” 更正式，常用于分析或评价表面与实质的差异，强调其作为社会认知或象征的层面。
“Outward” 是形容词，意为‘外在的’，常与 ‘appearance’ 搭配使用（如 outward appearance），但本身不表示具体形象，而是修饰词。而 “appearance” 是名词，指具体的可见形态或行为表现，是可观察的实体。
“Show” (展示) 强调主动的、有意识的呈现，如 “put on a show”，常含伪装或表演的意味。而 “appearance” 更中性，可指自然或被动的出现，不一定包含表演意图，如 ‘a sudden appearance of the moon’。
